definitions.definition: To cut a piece of wood to be the stick member of a cope-and-stick joint.
To compose; to set, or arrange, in a composing stick.
To furnish or set with sticks.
To become or remain attached; to adhere.
definitions.example: The tape will not stick if it melts.

definitions.definition: To jam; to stop moving.
definitions.example: The lever sticks if you push it too far up.

definitions.definition: To tolerate, to endure, to stick with.
To persist.
Of snow, to remain frozen on landing.
To remain loyal; to remain firm.
definitions.example: Just stick to your strategy, and you will win.

definitions.definition: To hesitate, to be reluctant; to refuse (in negative phrases).
To be puzzled (at something), have difficulty understanding.
To cause difficulties, scruples, or hesitation.
To attach with glue or as if by gluing.
definitions.example: Stick the label on the jar.

definitions.definition: To place, set down (quickly or carelessly).
definitions.example: Stick your bag over there and come with me.

definitions.definition: To press (something with a sharp point) into something else.
definitions.example: The balloon will pop when I stick this pin in it.

definitions.definition: To fix on a pointed instrument; to impale.
definitions.example: to stick an apple on a fork

definitions.definition: To adorn or deck with things fastened on as by piercing.
To perform (a landing) perfectly.
definitions.example: Once again, the world champion sticks the dismount.

definitions.definition: To propagate plants by cuttings.
(joinery) To run or plane (mouldings) in a machine, in contradistinction to working them by hand. Such mouldings are said to be stuck.
To bring to a halt; to stymie; to puzzle.
definitions.example: to stick somebody with a hard problem

definitions.definition: To impose upon; to compel to pay; sometimes, to cheat.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To stand pat: to cease taking any more cards and finalize one's hand.
A sequence or arrangement of drum notes to be played with drumsticks.
